intro: Chrysoma uniligulata, commonly known as the narrow-lipped sunflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and other sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions, showcasing adaptations to drought and poor soil conditions. Its flowers are yellow with a central disk, and it produces small, linear leaves. Chrysoma uniligulata is often found in rocky or sandy habitats, contributing to the biodiversity of its native ecosystems.
